definition: breakthrough/to overcome an obstacle quickly
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Hundreds were flooded out when the canal burst its bank.
sentences.chinese: 洪水衝破河堤，成千上萬的人們背井離鄉。

sentences.english: A surge of demonstrators broke through the fence.
They bite their way out of the caterpillar and begin spinning cocoons.
sentences.chinese: 然後它們會尋路衝破毛毛蟲體外開始做繭。

sentences.english: Storms break through the night cage to welcome the brilliant tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨衝破夜的樊籠，迎接燦爛的明天。

sentences.english: The citizens sallied out in an attempt to break the siege.
sentences.chinese: 市民們進行突擊，試圖衝破包圍。

sentences.english: Cows, on the other hand, routinely break down fences to get at corn.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，這些牛總是衝破柵欄去偷喫玉米。

sentences.english: After the storm the sun broke through the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 風暴過後太陰衝破了雲層。

sentences.english: The news was that the mob had broken down the barricades and were even then preparing to storm the palace.
sentences.chinese: 傳來的消息說暴民已經衝破了路障，正準備直搗宮廷。

sentences.english: A thousand constables cordoned off the riot area.
sentences.chinese: 示威者衝破了警察的警戒線。

sentences.english: What is the alchemy of fear breaking?
sentences.chinese: 衝破恐懼的點金術究竟是什麼東西？

sentences.english: Ah through a blizzard, we in a sleigh.
sentences.chinese: 啊衝破大風雪，我們坐在雪橇上。

sentences.english: Initially crude seemed to break convincingly higher yesterday helped by a continuingly strong equity market.
sentences.chinese: 受股市幫助，原油開始衝破高點。

sentences.english: It is a difficult and long-term task to break through the shackles of clan authority.
sentences.chinese: 要使壯族婚姻衝破族權的桎梏，任重而道遠。

sentences.english: An impulse of feeling now overcame her timidity , and Hetty spoke.
sentences.chinese: 一陣感情激動衝破了羞怯，海蒂終於說話了。

sentences.english: The barriers of the old 19th century class system are in many ways being broken down.
sentences.chinese: 十九世紀等級制度的森嚴壁壘，大都被衝破了。

sentences.english: Dashing through the snow, In a one-horse open sleigh.
sentences.chinese: 衝破大風雪，我們坐在雪橇上。

definition: a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
whirlwind/violent wind
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
click-through rate (for websites or online advertisements)
to stop/to resist/to obstruct
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
click-through rate (CTR) (Internet)
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to accumulate
to suppress/to beat down
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to collapse/to crumble/to fall apart
